item.title: Report I-2024080058
item.description:
Report I-2024080058

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: Norcross
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 08/13/2024, hidden dangerous goods were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the DHL AHN Service Center, 4437 Park Drive, Norcross, GA 30093 I Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains UN3481 Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment Class 9 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Case Material of Construction: Plastic Package Capacity: 50 g Amount in Package: 50 g Number in Shipment: 3 Number Failed: 3

item.title: Report E-2024080513
item.description:
Report E-2024080513

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 6, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon jugs of UN2922 were punctured on the bottom and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior, pallet, and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized absorbents and neutralizing agent to remediate the site. All impacted absorbents were collected in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged jugs were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080373
item.description:
Report E-2024080373

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: CONLEY
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 13, 2024, at 2050 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Conley, Georgia regarding the release of Socar Brake Wash (UN1208, Hexanes, 3, II). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 20 gallons of Socar Brake Wash (UN1208, Hexanes, 3, II) from (1) 55-gallon DM. The release was caused by a forklift puncture and impacted a 15ft x 20ft area of concrete on the dock floor. Contractors reported that the release had completely evaporated by the time they arrived. Contractors placed the damaged drum with the remaining product into a 65-gallon metal overpack then staged the waste onsite for proper disposal.
